header.title: Mezlim, Volume 1, Issue No. 5
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Magick, Shamanism, Tarot, Astrology

central_thesis: This journal issue explores the evolving landscape of contemporary magick, advocating for a shift from rigid, traditional, and 'hero-worshipping' approaches to a more sovereign, adaptable, and personally integrated practice for the 'New Aeon'. It presents diverse systems and philosophies that encourage practitioners to define their own magical paths, synthesize psychological insights, and engage with both inner and outer worlds through innovative rituals and self-expression.

structure_content.summary: Kenneth Deigh introduces the 'New Aeon' as a potential Golden Age for Magick and Magi, emphasizing the need for individuals to challenge limitations, create new worlds, and embrace personal sovereignty in an era of increasing instability and global communication, identifying magick's reawakening in modern psychology, quantum mechanics, and chaos physics.

Donald Michael Kraig critiques the contemporary occult community for 'hero worship' of past figures (e.g., Golden Dawn, Crowley) and the prevalence of 'bogus operators'. He advocates for innovation and the creation of new magical systems that learn from history but are not confined by it, asserting that the 'Age of Aquarius' demands a shift from Piscean-era mindsets that rely on external proof and leadership.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Shadow Tarot: Birthing The Dark Feminine Within
structure_content.summary: Linda Falorio introduces 'The Shadow Tarot', a system of 22 paintings representing the Tunnels of Set (Qliphoth) aimed at exploring and integrating the 'dark feminine energies of the Soul'. Drawing inspiration from Aleister Crowley's Liber 231 and Kenneth Grant's Nightside of Eden, this work seeks to bring balance to the microcosm and macrocosm by pathworking the subconscious realms and challenging self-imposed limitations born of fear.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Urban Shaman: Alive and Working in the Big City
structure_content.summary: Kenneth Deigh redefines the role of the shaman for the modern 'Major Metropolitan Area'. He argues that urban shamans must adapt their practices to a diverse, unstable environment, emphasizing self-definition, the ability to enter altered states to explore the 'Inner World', and guide others through internal landscapes. The article stresses the importance of understanding one's own symbols before relating to others' and finding a healthy, sustainable path.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Rite of the Milk of the Stars, mark.6 to replace The Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram
structure_content.summary: Sam Webster presents an alternative ceremonial ritual to the Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram (LRP), designed for the 'self-sovereign mage' and Thelemic pagan. It replaces Yahwistic elements with Greek cosmological terms in the 'Quantum Cross' (CHAOS, COSMOS, EROS, NUOS, SYNCHRONOS, ALLAGE) and Thelemic Archæ (THERION, BABALON, HADIT, NUIT) in the quarters, aiming for an elegant, non-supplicatory, and individually customizable system that recapitulates Creation and asserts the practitioner's will.

Diane Tabor explores the psychological underpinnings of ritual in magick, drawing on Jungian concepts. She posits that ritual is crucial for establishing communication between the conscious and subconscious minds, using symbolic action and archetypes to access psychic energy. Ritual helps balance personality structure, integrate 'personifications of energy' (Woman, Man, Child), and develop the mental discipline to focus power and project will onto reality.

AMENARA shares a personal account of internal workings within the 'Sheya system', detailing a 'Spell of Enki'. This involves constructing an internal 'temple' or cosmos, charging cornerstones with intentions (Enochi, Dhyanna, Maggah, Khiyatta), defining the 'Aspects of Enki' (ALEPH, NUN, KAPH, YOD, ENOCHI), and invoking various states of being ('I AM THE SWORD', 'I AM THE WOUND', 'I AM THE ROSE', 'I AM THE CHILD WHO CARRIES HIR MOTHER AND FATHER WITHIN HIR WOMB', 'I AM THE SERPENT ARISING, REBORN INTO THE WORLD') to align with and manifest personal Will.

key_concepts.definition: A potential Golden Age for Magick and Magi, characterized by increasing instability and global communication, demanding personal sovereignty, challenging inherited limitations, and fostering creative adaptation in magical practice.

A unique Tarot system comprising 22 paintings of the Tunnels of Set (Qliphoth), designed as yantras to explore and integrate 'dark feminine energies of the Soul' to achieve microcosmic and macrocosmic balance, based on Aleister Crowley's Liber 231 and Kenneth Grant's Nightside of Eden.

An individual who adapts shamanic practices to the modern metropolitan environment, defined by their ability to enter altered states, navigate their 'Inner World' (complete with urban archetypes), interact with totemic pantheons, and guide others, emphasizing self-definition and practical application in a diverse context.

A foundational gesture in 'The Rite of the Milk of the Stars' that replaces the Qabalistic Cross, invoking fundamental forces and structures through terms like CHAOS, COSMOS, EROS, NUOS, SYNCHRONOS, and a customizable 'metaword' (e.g., ALLAGE), designed to unify time and facilitate willful change.

Placeholder words within rituals, such as 'ALLAGE' in the 'Quantum Cross', which are intended to be replaced by the practitioner with more specific words that encrypt the particular nature of the magical working, allowing for individual customization and alignment with personal will.

A personal, transformative magickal path that involves constructing an internal 'temple' or cosmos aligned with the practitioner's Will, utilizing cornerstones charged with specific intentions and defining 'Aspects of Enki' to integrate and manifest personal power and understanding.

Symbolic forms (e.g., Woman, Man, Child, circle, quaternary, higher self) present in the collective unconscious that, when consciously manipulated in ritual, facilitate communication with the subconscious mind, balance personality structures, and focus psychic energy for magical manifestation and personal growth.

A state of dissolving subjective identification with internal states, forces, and aspects, utilized in ParaTheatrical Research to cultivate receptivity, foster internal dependence, and create a 'vertical stability' that enables 'miraculous interactions' and bypasses rational thought.

practical_system.description: The journal presents several practical systems and approaches. 'The Rite of the Milk of the Stars' provides a structured ceremonial ritual for banishing/invoking, rooted in Thelemic and Greek cosmology, emphasizing individual sovereignty and customizable 'metawords'. 'The Shadow Tarot' introduces a meditative pathworking system for exploring the 'Tunnels of Set' to integrate dark feminine energies. 'The Urban Shaman' outlines a framework for adapting shamanic practices to a modern, urban environment, focusing on inner world exploration and self-defined roles. 'The Sheya System' describes a highly personal, introspective ritual for constructing an internal 'temple' or cosmos aligned with the practitioner's Will. ParaTheatrical Research explores group dynamics and 'No-Form' states for 'miraculous interactions'. Practical 'Tips for the City Mage' provide creative solutions for adapting temple setup in limited spaces.
tools: The practitioner's own body and mind (for most rituals).
Shadow Tarot paintings and sigils (for Shadow Tarot pathworking).
Symbolic urban elements (e.g., traffic lights, cabs, herb gardens for Urban Shamanism).

Creative alternatives for traditional temple items for 'City Mages': Double cube altar (parsons table with satin), pillars (cardboard tubes with plywood/styrofoam bases), votive candles in colored glasses with coffee can stands, elemental tablets (astrological signs on cardboard).
Tarot decks and reading cloth (for Tarology).
Appropriate background music (for masking ritual sounds in urban settings).
rituals: The Rite of the Milk of the Stars (replacing LRP): Involves the 'Quantum Cross' (using CHAOS, COSMOS, EROS, NUOS, SYNCHRONOS, a metaword like ALLAGE), 'Calling the Quarters' with widdershins pentagrams and specific tetragrammatons (F.I.A.T., M.A.A.T., A.P.E.P., A.T.O.M.), 'Conjuration of the Archæ' (invoking THERION, BABALON, HADIT, NUIT), and a 'Grand Conjuration' where the practitioner identifies as 'the Woman that jetteth out the milk of the stars'.

Shadow Tarot Pathworking: Utilizes 22 paintings of the Tunnels of Set and ancient magickal sigils as visual yantras for projecting consciousness through Daath to explore 'dark feminine power', including realms of the Ancient One, Faceless One, Dark Goddess, and Ereshkigal, aiming for balance and wholeness.

Urban Shamanic Journeying: Involves moving into altered states to explore one's 'Inner World', interacting with archetypes (totemic pantheon), and guiding others through internal landscapes. Practices are adapted to urban living, emphasizing internal preparation over external traditional settings.

Spell of Enki (Sheya System): A multi-stage personal ritual that begins by declaring oneself at the center of the universe, moving into a void state, and then symbolically constructing an internal 'temple' or 'space' by placing 'cornerstones' charged with specific intentions (Enochi, Dhyanna, Maggah, Khiyatta). It proceeds to define and embody 'Aspects of Enki' (ALEPH, NUN, KAPH, YOD, ENOCHI) and culminates in invocations of 'I AM THE SWORD', 'I AM THE WOUND', 'I AM THE ROSE', 'I AM THE CHILD WHO CARRIES HIR MOTHER AND FATHER WITHIN HIR WOMB', and 'I AM THE SERPENT ARISING, REBORN INTO THE WORLD', concluding with a banishing and invocation of Nuit to Hadit.

ParaTheatrical Research Group Rituals: Structured processes including physical warm-ups, 'No-Form' stances to cultivate receptivity and 'vertical stability', selecting a quality or force for contact, and engaging in 'self-commitment' to an internal source within a group setting, aiming for 'miraculous interactions' and collective consciousness expansion.

relevant_quotes.text: This is the New Aeon, a potential Golden Age for Magick and Magi. This is the age of sovereignty for all who are prepared to do their Work and their Will.

But the point I want to stress is that the Golden Dawn created something new. They created a true mystery school with their own system of development and magick based on ancient tradition. Today, most self-proclaimed magicians are content to mouth words written a century ago and modified by others since. This is not magick. This is Hero worship!
The Shadow Tarot exists to bring the World— both Microcosm and Macrocosm — back into balance. It is but one manifestation of a lifelong quest for healing and wholeness...
There is no one tradition which can reveal all the mysteries with which we live. There is only your own process - your own inner direction - to lead you to continuous growth and recognition.

However, the Lesser Ritual of the Pentagram (LRP) is one of the most elegant rites in the repertoire of the Ceremonial Mage. The harmonies between its symbols and its effects run very deep and thus it has been of great use to magi for over one hundred years. It is the first ritual learned by most magi and so it has a very special place in their hearts. Nevertheless it calls upon Jehovah and does so in a supplicating and self-abnegating manner, indeed "For Thine is the Kingdom." This is intolerable for this self-sovereign mage and a thelemic pagan such as myself.
To utilize its power one must have the psychic energy (drawn the subconscious) and the vehicle with which to manifest the symbolic material.

I stand as the center pillar of my cosmos, born of my Will, to know my Will, for this is the Way. From this center there are infinite reflections. I have built my space. I have named this space Enki, and have given it four Aspects for cornerstones.

Thus, I believe that the current state of magick is at a turning point. For the most part, it is still composed of the antiquated ideas taken from the Piscean age. But more and more research and practical work are being done, and the possibilities are truly endless.

critical_analysis.relevance: This journal is highly relevant for contemporary magical practitioners seeking to move beyond rigid, dogmatic systems and adapt their practice to modern contexts. It directly addresses the need for personal sovereignty, innovation, and the integration of psychological insights within esoteric work. By offering reformulations of classic rituals and new systems like the Shadow Tarot and Urban Shamanism, it provides practical pathways for magicians to engage with the 'New Aeon's challenges and opportunities, fostering a more personalized and effective approach to magick.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes experienced magicians, Thelemites, Wiccans, Pagans, ceremonial mages, urban shamans, psychonauts, and occult scholars who are actively engaged in personal spiritual development and magical practice. It particularly appeals to those who are critical of traditional limitations, open to interdisciplinary approaches (psychology, art), and dedicated to experimenting with and adapting magical systems to their individual will and modern environment.
